Reviews.Content: Good Location, cruddy room No lobby, small, crowded office. Employees were pretty nice, helpful. The location was great - in the quiet residential section of the quarter. We had to schlup our stuff up stairs onto a rickety, interior balcony - Our stark room did have adequate closet space, the beds were comfy - no headboards though. Furnished in old junky furniture - the bathroom was spartan as well but the shower did have good water pressure and I almost scalded myself, so be careful about the hot water! We enjoyed missing/broken window panes, so clean, fresh air kept the room well-ventilated. Paid too much because at least two big conventions were in town. Continental breakfast was below average - a few hard croissants and rolls and small styrofoam cups for the coffee. Would stay again if the price was 1/4 of what we had to pay.
Reviews.Author: marysmom1

Reviews.Content: Quiet and secluded. Historic. Great Value.       our room overlooking the courtyard
Reviews.Author: WhoDat76

Reviews.Content: Will be back again and again!! My husband and I decided to go to New Orleans for our honeymoon and happened across the website for St. Peters. We had the time of our lives! The whole staff was warm and friendly throughout our trip and the room was exquisite, done in beautiful antiques. The stairs and balcony scared me a bit at first as it looks like maybe it hasn't been fully repaired since Katrina but it must've been safe as nothing happened. We absolutely loved the location. We parked the car in a garage a few blocks over and never picked it up again until we were heading home. We didn't have to!! Everything we needed/wanted to see and do was well within walking distance!! It was sad to leave and the staff had been so good I wanted to hug them before we left as they had come to seem like family. As we headed home we knew we would be back as often as possible and definetly would stay at St. Peters again!!Samantha Dean
Reviews.Author: tanta101

Reviews.Content: A Step Above!! I'm not sure how much some of the people who wrote negative things about this hotel drank while in New Orleans, but it must have been a lot. From the moment I stepped inside the little front office I was greated and treated with nothing but what I can only assume is pure Southern Hospitality!!From what i learned the building is hundreds of years old, so all the little quirks and inperfections made it feel like home and not a stuffy 30 story building with beds. I had never been to New Orleans and everyone on the staff was very helpful with guiding me in the right direction. I will stay here everytime I go to New Orleans in the future, and there will be future trips!Thank You Everyone!!!!
Reviews.Author: kynetikrealityy

Reviews.Content: It is what it is. Well...after reading the reviews I understand the extremes. It IS in a good location-3 blocks from Burbon Street-but on the north side of the French Quarter-keeps it cheap but some walking to get south of Burbon. Some rooms are big (ours was a large 2 bedroom suite) some are really small (I saw one getting cleaned that could barely fit a bed!). The front desk was hit or miss...either super helpful or clueless. Housekeeping did not show the first day but did the second but not the third. For what we paid in a room that fit 6 people easily we were happy. We had a semi-private entrance, a balcony and a fridge and microwave. BUT I felt more like we were staying at a friends house than at a hotel or bed and breakfast. Or a nice hostel. The decor is rather threadbare but we felt safe and the linens were clean even if the floors were not. Bring extra socks or slippers for the dirty floors (tile), bring shampoo and conditioner, bring a hairdryer and bring earplugs due to the old window unit air conditioners being loud. If you do that while thinking how little you spent on the room you will be happy.
Reviews.Author: Schluh

Reviews.Content: Unsafe and really needs renovation!! Exposed wiring, faulty plumbing, windows painted shut, rotting floor boards on balcony. The list goes on and on. Stay somewhere else!
Reviews.Author: JT66

Reviews.Content: Loved it - Definitely coming back I loved my two-night stay at St. Peter's and agree with the many glowing reviews on this site. The location is perfect of course. And in my room, 33, the bed was sound and comfortable, the linens were spotless. Plenty of storage space in the closet. The floors, the (big) bathroom, etc. were sparkling clean, corners and all. The staff are friendly, smiling, knowledgeable and entirely professional.I'm puzzled by reviews that complain that St. Peter's is old and not a cookie-cutter Holiday Inn-type place. Well...it's an 1805 building on the National Registry of Historic Places, in the French Quarter of New Orleans. It's not a McDonald's. I'm thrilled that we have the opportunity not just to admire the beauty and style of these lovely buildings from the outside, but to actually get to stay in those such as St. Peter's whose owners and caretakers work hard to maintain historical integrity while modernizing up for our pleasure. I look forward to my next stay at this delightful hotel.
Reviews.Author: Anne_in_33

Reviews.Content: Great Location - Terrible Hotel Blood stains on the comforter. Cigarette burns on the sheets. Unidentifiable stains on pillow cases. Dead cockroaches under bed. Very uncooperative management. That's just for starters. Their website is VERY misleading. Rooms looked to be ROOMY on the site. But when we arrived - they are very small. And look NOTHING like the pictures.We'd leave for the day in the morning, then arrive back at the hotel around 5pm, only to find that our room hadn't been cleaned. (new towels - bed made). The bed linen was disgusting. When we asked for a replacement blanket - the other one was WORSE! Yeah, It's kinda quaint in an old run-down and dangerous kind of way because of the collapsing balcony and staircase, and yeah, it's in a great location in the French Quarter, but man oh man, do these people not care about providing decent, and clean linen for the rooms. They had brand new flat screen TVs put in prior to us arriving, but with no remote. They seem put out when we asked for one. Got one. A brand new one Still in the box. We had to program the damn thing for it to work with the TV in the room.It was a roof over our head - we got some free danishes and coffee - and we got to watch Wizard Of Oz. Other than that, it wasn't a pleasant experience. I will not be staying there again.
Reviews.Author: mzmeryze

Reviews.Content: Very small, very run down. We started out with problems over reservations, it all went downhill from there. Management was very disagreeable. The room we were given was tiny. A corner room on the second story around 8ft. by 10 ft. (if that large) with a double bed and one small armoire not large enough to store anything in and only with those two pieces of furniture there was very little room to move around the bed. The balcony and stairs were in such a state of disrepair I was afraid to walk on them.
Reviews.Author: monibh

Reviews.Content: Very Run-Down Okay when I booked this room my expectations were very low. I mean come on at this price the hotel can't be very good. It managed to disappoint me even with my low expectations. I had a balcony room facing the street. The room had a bed, a night stand big enough for a lamp and a chest. That's it. Not one chair. The phone was under the bed. The tv's are lcd which is nice but they are small and the was NO remote. The power also went out several times a day because the hotel could not handle all of the power needs. Try and avoid this hotel if you can.
Reviews.Author: PaulHunter

Reviews.Content: Huge disappointment We rented a 2BR suite for 4 of us Jazz Fest weekend. The space was large w/ 3 good-sized beds, but other than that the place looked like it was decorated with furniture from someone's garage. There was a small, broken couch and 2 armchairs, a small coffee table, a desk with broken drawer and that's it. And the floors were so filthy we couldn't walk barefoot without turning our feet black. When this was pointed out to mgmt, the cleaning crew came in and bleached the place so much we could feel our eyes burning. And the floors were still filthy under the bleach! Afraid to complain again, we just stuck it out, but if it hadn't been jazz fest, we would've looked hard for a different place to stay.
Reviews.Author: shiner179

Reviews.Content: Good location, good price My husband and I traveled to New Orleans for Jazz Fest and stayed from April 26 through the 29. This was my 5th trip to New Orleans, and my husband's 3rd. It was my first time staying in the French Quarter and to Jazz Fest.We stayed at St. Peter House, which is on the corner of St. Peter and Burgundy in the French Quarter. The architecture and personality of the building made you feel like you were staying in New Orelans. It was a great location - walking distance to everything. It was a few blocks up from Bourbon Street, but the noise and the smell were undetectable ;).I had booked us a double room - just one double bed, because it was much cheaper. Much to my surprise, our room not only had a king size bed, but a sitting room as well! It was huge (I'd estimate nearly 600 square feet)! My husband and I are pretty laid back about a hotel if it is on the cheaper end, but there were some things to take note of if high quality is a priority of yours. They did not change our sheets everyday, but changed our towels. The floors were tile, not carpeted, and there were no rugs, so I wore my socks all the time in the room (which became quite dirty on the bottom). We had trouble every time we tried to lock and unlock our door because it was a traditional key lock and I believe the lock was old. There was no shampoo, conditioner, hair dryer, or anything of that sort. It was basically a good place to crash at the end of the night and to be able to pop into during the day.
Reviews.Author: TravelingChick23510

Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, fair rooms A very similar experience as the last review. We are a family of four that stayed a Sunday night upon returning from a cruise.Not your typical hotel experience as this place was obviously a traditional 1800 quarter home or series of homes. Once you check-in, they lead you to the outside door that leads to your group of rooms (some up, some down). Staff was friendly, and was able to let us check in around 12n so that we could store our numerous bags in the room. The lobby was a very small secure space where they check you in/out, set out pastries/coffee, and allow people to store bags (if there is space).Our room was fairly basic with two queen sized beds, a couple of closets, and a basic motel style bathroom. It was not a balcony room, so our windows actually faced out toward a small courtyard (nothing spectacular, but very traditional). The room included a wall a/c unit (worked fine, although we just used the ceiling fan), a basic phone (we didn't try it), and a flat screen TV (worked fine). You actually get a real set of keys, so don't loose them.The location was great. Very convenient to the heart of the quarter and Jackson Square. If you are looking for a fair priced traditional style hotel that is in the quarter, I'd recommend it. If you are used to your cookie cutter hotels with all the standard amenities, this is probably not the place for you.
Reviews.Author: AZVIKKI

Reviews.Content: Good value for the price. Stayed in the St Peter House 3 nights the week after Mardi Gras. This was my first visit to New Orleans. An overview:Check-in process/Staff: The staff was always very pleasant Room: This is a very old building, the room was clean but had age issues: 1) the mattress was very old and very soft, 2) all floors creaked and I could hear most activity from the neighboring rooms. 3) Breakfast was a few muffins with coffee. 4) The bathroom was clean. Area: This hotel was 2 blocks north of Bourbon Street, which was an advantage because of its closeness while still a semi quiet night. I recommend running the air conditioner at night which reduces the outside noise.All in all, this was a good value for the money, was a good experience and this review is not meant to discourage others from staying here, only to give an opinion.
Reviews.Author: makua

Reviews.Content: I love St. Peter House Hotel I do not understand how anyone could write a bad review of The St. Peter Guest House. The staff are wonderful. The rooms are clean, and renovated since my last visit (I am a repeat visitor, been there in 2003, 2004 and August, 2006). I thought everything was great. The room was nice and big and cool. It was refreshing to take a good shower after walking in the humid weather. This hotel is more like a little quaint bed and breakfast. It is quiet and yet only two blocks from Bourbon Street. They even give you a nice continental breakfast. They are friendly and helpful and I look forward to my next visit. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in the French Quarter.
Reviews.Author: babe123

Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel I recently stayed at this hotel and would not advise anyone else to do the same. First of all, what you see in the photos of the rooms/hotel are not what you get. Although it looks really nice, it is a dump. Our air conditioning did not work properly, we literally spent the whole weekend sweating, and when we told the front desk about it we were told that they could not move us to another room but would have maintenance check it. They never did. There are no telephones in the rooms, the floors are filthy, and there were massive cock roaches in the room. It took forever to get hot water and by the time we left, the toilet had also backed up. The balcony/walkway area is scary, you feel like you may fall through the floor and there is no night lighting so you have to use a flashlight or lighter to find your room at night. The only good thing about the hotel is it's proximity to Bourbon Street.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: We've stayed many times My wife and I have stayed here several times. We've never had a problem. I think some people mistake pristine for clean. They have to remember that it is an old building. It isn't a cookie cutter hotel. We stay here and others like it because of the character and charm of the buildings and their elegant decay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! We stayed for 8 days in the St Peter House Hotel and had a wonderful time. It was not just the location but our room was clean and great value for the price. The staff were fantastic and our breakfasts in the courtyard each morning before heading off for the day's activities will be remembered for a long time.
Reviews.Author: liscard

Reviews.Content: Absolutley Love This Hotel! The St. Peter House is the most beautiful place I've stayed on vacation. The staff are the friendliest and the character is amazing! I love the furniture and the spirit. Now, spirit is what I loved most about it. There are great stories about this hotel and I've experienced it in person. Go on the haunted history tour and ask about this hotel. I did after a neat experience when i stayed here. This will be the only place i recommend people to stay. And when I'm back in 3-4 years St. Peter House will be there for me!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Cracking budget hotel Having read some previous reviews of the St Peters guest house I was apprehensive when arriving at the hotel. I needn't have been. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The layout of the hotel is a little unusual (it is a very old traditional building in New Orleans) and we did have to leave the reception and go around the corner and through another door to find our room. This wasn't a problem though. The building is a rabbit warren and this type of thing is inevitable. The hotel is in a fantastic location, only 200m from Bourbon St and 400m from Jackson square. In spite of this, it is very quiet in the hotel. The hotel provides free pastrys and coffee in the morning and also has a wonderful little courtyard to sit in. I certainly didn't feel unsafe there. The room I stayed in was quite spacious. I would recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: simonmcc

Reviews.Content: No complaint at all Friendly, helpful reception staff, excellent rooms, excellent setting. Reading previous reviews, we were a little anxious, but without good cause. I would not hesitate to recommend this as a good low budget hotel, convenient for the Quarter, and with good amenities. It's also perfectly safe.
Reviews.Author: SH23

Reviews.Content: Only good part is the location The pics of the rooms on the website look nothing like that in person. They are small and musty. Mine and my husband's allergies and sinus were acting up the whole time while we were there. I know it is an historic house but A LOT of spring cleaning and fresh paint could go a LONG way! The location was great but that is about it! The staff was nice but seemed unorganized. If all you care about is the location then this is a good place to stay but if you want anything extra look else where.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Budget Hotel Worth the Money Please ignore the information February 12th posted. The area is very safe and it is in prime location. The bars around and near the hoel are local places. Bourban Street is only about 2 blocks away. I live in New York, and I felt SAFE walking back to the hotel at night. I stayed at St. Peters House October 2004 and had a great time. I really can't understand how people just lie and go overboard. Ok the hotel is not the Ritz but I think it is the best kept secret in the French Quarter . Especially when you are coming into town when there is a festival on. So if your looking to stay at the Ritz spend your $350.00 a night. I rather spend $$ amount on a hotel and go to the most expensive restaurants New Orleans has to offer. I just booked a 3 night stay at St. Peters House for the French Quarter Festival. Also I am not the type who sits in the hotel room for the majority of my trip. I am on VACATION and I am in New Orleans to enjoy the Big Easy.
Reviews.Author: lpnewyork

Reviews.Content: Still Wonderful I just spent another 7 days at St. Peter House for Mardi Gras. Everything was just wonderful. I have read some of the other reviews and have experienced none of those problems. My room has always been very clean and comfortable. The management and staff were very attentive and courtious. The morning pastries and coffee were always fresh. It is under new management so maybe some of the problems experienced were during that transition. As far as feeling safe, I feel more comfortable walking to The St. Peter House than I do trying to get down to some of the hotels near or across Canal St. It is only a couple blocks off Bourbon St. in a more residential area. Staying here you get the true feeling of the New Orleans French Quarter, I much prefer stepping out of my room onto the balcony with the sights and sounds of the French Quarter before me, than dealing with sealed windows, long hallways, elevators and hotel lobbies. I will definitely be staying here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't even think about staying here! When my daughter and I arrived from the airport, our taxi cab driver told us, Do not even think of walking around this area at night! Our room was located down a narrow alley off of a courtyard. There are absolutely NO amenities in this place and if you are into scary movies, this is one big nightmare. We felt like we were on the movie set for Psycho! Very scary, unsafe, isolated, sketchy! We immediately called for a cab to take us to a different hotel and told the woman at the desk that we were leaving. I can only compare the hotel and immediate area to a depressed and impoverished area of a major city, for example, Newark, NJ! Clearly, we were lucky we could leave...alive!I recommend the Doubletree Hotel in Metaire or the Hyatt a short ride from the Convention Center. If you are NOT coming down with your fraternity but rather as husband and wife, or with children or by yourself, take my word for it and do not come here!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't stay in room 12! If you like musty, old, window unit heating and air conditioning with no thermostat, a 17 TV with bad reception (how do you get cable with bad reception?), and generally unclean rooms - here's the place for you. However, the location is great and the rate is very good from what my wife tells me (She researched the prices on the internet). Make sure you go to Hillery's for dinner just down the street and have the spinach salad! Its awesome!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Absolutely HORRIBLE!! We stayed at The St. Peter House the night of January 3 and it was by far the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel! We checked in and our room was not ready. We dropped off our stuff and left for some sightseeing. We returned to what seemed to be a clean room. However, when we turned down our beds we found long black hairs! The couple in the room next to us found short pubic hairs and a crusty stain on their sheets. The toilet was stained with what looked like puke. We were so grossed out that we slept on top of the bed fully clothed. It was the most uncomfortable night of sleep I have ever gotten. The next morning we went downstairs to check out and one of the men grabbed a muffin from the continental breakfast bar. He took a bite before realizing it had mold on it!! I know their rates are cheap at this hotel, but I would not stay here again if they paid me to!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Been there, and doing it again This place is awesome. Me and my girlfriend had such a good experience the first time we stayed there that we are staying there again in a week. We trust them enough to bring some family that flew in last night with us and get them a room too. The architecture is great, the balcony is great, the court yard is great and the staff is great. It's all great. And as far as the carpets go..well..our room was very clean.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Stayed here for three nights 2nd to 5th October. The room was HUGE and really comfortable. Located just a couple of blocks from Bourbon Street made it ideal for a night out- not too far to stagger back!! The room rate was very good in my opinion- especially as the Continental breakfast was included and tea and coffee all day- not something we got anywhere else that we stayed. (Mind you, we never did get up early enough to have it)Our room was not cleaned while we stayed- but that was our fault as we put the privacy sign on the door and forgot to take it off- so I'm sorry if we left it too much of a mess!! I also liked the fact that there was a notice saying that they DIDN'T change the towels every day unless you indicated otherwise to be environmentally friendly- again something that we didn't see in any of the other hotels we stayed in.The only thing- we stupidly left some souvenirs behind and I am so gutted!! Oh well- thats what Bourbon Street does to you, I suppose. While we were there we did a swamp tour and I would reccomend it to anyone- the guide was excellent and so informative about the region and cajun and creole history.We are hoping to go to the US again in a couple of years and want to see New Orleans again as we only had 3 nights and we will definately stay here again.Thanks to all.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Filthy and run down We think St. Peter needs to bless this mess and clean up the dinghy rooms and sloppy courtyard. Our room smelled of mildew or worse yet - urine. The ac was dirty and blew out dust and the bathtub didn't empty the whole time we were there. Housekeeping staff was nice, but no one including the manager seemed to care about anyone except themselves. I'd stay away from the cheap prices and go with a reputable hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay anywhere else I just got back from my second trip to New Orleans (went last August too) and stayed at the St. Peter House again. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. It is quiet, the room was very nice and clean, the hotel staff is extremely helpful and nice, the continental breakfast is always good, the room is very reasonable, you are so close to Bourbon Street and Cafe Du Monde and the New Orleans School of Cooking (which I attended), and I just can't wait to go back to New Orleans and I would recommend the St. Peter House to everyone - from people travelling alone to couples, to people with children. Thank you for another wonderful experience. I will be back and hopefully before next August!
Reviews.Author: pmillsaps

Reviews.Content: Don't stay in room 37! We got a great price on room 37. However, it was street level at an intersection and faced a bar. The room was very clean and charming but the noise was awful. Cars, motorcycles, music from the bar across the street. However, we were there for less than 12 hours and, after a few hours on Bourbon St and a few Hurricanes, we fell right to sleep. The staff and the rest of the hotel was very pleasant. Just don't let them put you in room 37 if you plan on staying more than one night that doesn't include alcohol.
Reviews.Author: WallyDog

Reviews.Content: In all fairness... When I read the trip advisor reviews for this hotel, I was mentally prepared for a gamble. I've visited New Orleans for 25 years, so I never expect perfection in buildings that were built in the 1800's. It was the complaints about human error and lack of concern that had me on alert and ready with a plan B.I travelled with a group of friends, so did not book through the normal reservation system I've used in the past. This was their trip and they kindly invited me along.We arrived at St. Peter House Hotel at 10 a.m. after a 12 plus hour road trip. I know that technical check-in is at 3 p.m. I'm always prepared for that, but have never really had to wait. We did wait for our room until a few minutes before 3. Occupying myself until then didn't bother me, but I do wish I had brought an easy access bag with a few things for freshening up. I didn't plan on wearing the coke-stained dress from the road trip all day....When we checked into room 21, everyone was pleased. It was spacious and *clean*. Having seen 4 females check into this room, a very gracious housekeeping lady brought a huge stash of extra towels, washcloths, and soaps. She did this each day we were there. We never had to ask her for anything.There were 3 window unit air conditioners in this apt. Temp control was easy. The balcony outside the window was spacious, shaded, and very accommodating.This room had a small refrigerator which is always great for stashing the second half of a po-boy.If I had gone to a 4 or 5 star hotel, I would have expected plush, clean carpet. Carpet gets dirty, period. Since I didn't sleep on the floor, this didn't bother me. I didn't wear white socks, so I can't tell you about a how dirty they might have gotten. My point: we paid a low rate for this room and the carpet was the only thing that wasn't clean. All other surfaces were spotless.I would have preferred that the dead bolt worked on the door, but it didn't. All other locks on the windows and doors were fine.We didn't encounter any rudeness at the desk or anywhere, for that matter. Of course, we weren't rude to them, either.I felt that a fair, neutral report was due. If you are high maintanence, this hotel is not for you. If you are a regular visitor to this wonderful neighborhood and just need a place to rest your weary bones, you'll probably be pleased.
Reviews.Author: DA35

Reviews.Content: Layed Back Staff makes it a good value I've stayed at this hotel two times. The first time we had some real problems with the room and found another place, but had to stay one more night before the other room was available. The staff at the St. Peter was very very appologetic and put us in an excellent room for that night. The rates were good, realistic. The second time we stayed here the room was very small, but inexpensive and very acceptable. My advise is that if you are hard to please you might want to go elsewhere, but if you can bend a little give these guys a chance and they will make it worth your while. It would be an excellent choice for Marti Gras as some of the rooms are absolutly huge and you could put down a lot of air beds. Enjoy!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: LOVED IT!! Just got back from staying at St Peters (literally) and wanted to say that we had an excellent time! The staff there was really cool and didnt bother us at all! The room was great and the location was awesome. Close to all the action but not to close that you couldnt sleep. We are already planning to stay at St Peters whenever we make it back to New Orleans which isnt soon enough for me! Thanks again to the staff at St Peters you guys rock! Jeanette and Chris
Reviews.Author: Morgaine

Reviews.Content: Confrim your reservations, incompetant woman at front desk! i dont know why everyones review on here is so bad. the accomodations were amazing. it seemed like we were staying in an apartement. there were three people in my party and we paid very little to stay in a two bedroom/queen size bed suite.the room was beautiful and spacious.. but unfortunately we had to deal with the old blonde woman at the front desk. if you get her, be warned she is incredibally unhelpful, ignorant and unwilling to help.we made online reservations and receive a confirmation email but when we came in to claim our room, she said there was nothing under the name we gave. we showed her our printed out confirmation and she wouldnt even read it.. saying oh computers, i cant deal with those things, i never use them SO why the hell would they have online reservations available? please call them after booking online, otherwise they will f you over. i really do think they had our name but just took a look at 3 kids with peircings/tattoos and decided to charge us more. a dark haired man then tried to help us, because we were getting absolutely no where with that woman. they also had us checking out on friday, when we were supposed to on saturday, so we had to pay more money and switch rooms.we had room 27 the first time. it was beautiful, i know that some of the rooms at st peter can be tiny though.no bloody sheets were found, the room was clean. the maid came daily. we did find a used condom ontop of the dresser the tv was in, in the living room area.. but i guess no one looks up there when theyre cleaning.. (We stood on top of a table to see it) its a great place, unfortunately the staff can be incredibally hard to deal with, especially the blonde woman.id stay there again just as long as we had the big room with the balcony.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time or money We wanted to save money on our trip by staying at the St Peter House, big MISTAKE. We booked online, website looked decent. Our room had no window, about the size of a closet and you had to step up about a foot to the bathroom and the bed was awful, at least we can laugh about it. You defintely get what you pay for, not much............
Reviews.Author: islandguy58

Reviews.Content: Honeymoon I was there on the last few days of jazz fest in May. Our flight was early and I knew we couldn't check in right away. It was very rainy and when we walked into the lobby all cheery and happy the blond lady at the desk just growled at us gave us a key to an OLD wooden closet in the outside garden and told us to put our things there, then just went on ignoring us. I never got ANY phone messages that where left for me. Wake-up call - HA - that's a laugh, I did ask for one in order to wake up on time for our swamp tour but no call came. The room is nice but not clean at all. Our room was on the ground floor and we had to wrestle about 2 pretty big roaches..... but I guess for the price.. if you don't mind a little unclean.... then it's not the worst place you can end up in.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not your Hilton or Holiday Inn Parts of all these reviews are partly true. Our room was clean, but small. The plumbing worked fine, TV was OK. To make up for the smallness, there was the balcony where we could have coffee. The staff was generally very nice. It seems their housekeeping system is somewhat nontraditional in that it's not automatic. One of the housekeepers would ask what you needed, and we learned just to say now new towels, but the general cleanup. You should not stay here if you have qualms about old places that aren't in pristine shape. (Our house here in DC is circa 1870s, and our floors show it.) We thought the price justified some of the run-downness, I even went and bought a cooler and a clock-radio. IMPORTANT INFO - the last day we were there, I asked the lady at the desk if we had the smallest room (number 49) and she said there were a couple that were about as small. We learned that we should have requested 46, 47, or 48.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good for the price We go to New Orleans often and usually stay at The Inn on Bourbon or the Prince Conti...very nice hotels. When my friends booked here, I was nervous based on the other reviews here. However, for the money, it was a nice hotel in a good location. The staff was always friendly. I was especially concerned since it's located 2 blocks north of Bourbon Street that it might be scary walking back to the room but the street was well-lit (as were we) and the walk was not intimidating at all. When we're looking for a bargain New Orleans weekend, we will definitely stay here again. If you're the fussy type, however, this place is probably not for you. The rooms are not nicely decorated and, although the rooms were not obviously dirty, they are old and just don't feel real clean.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: quaint spot first off, my wife and i don't go on vacation to spend time at the hotel. we don't need the gym, the big deal dining room and a guy to wait on you hand and foot. so if you need those things, st. peter guest house is not for you. this is not your high dollar boutique french quarter bb. but if you are looking for a simple room with a good location and the basics for a decent price you might want to consider this spot. we have stayed here maybe 10 times during the past 15 years. there have been some disappointments with service. some might not call it the cleanest hotel in the world as far as maid service. the fixtures are old but they work. the beds are ok. some of the rooms don't get much sun. but we love the balcony that fronts both burgundy and st. peter. it's a great place to sit and have the daily self-serve continental breakfast or an evening drink and watch the people go by. it's pretty quiet as the quarter goes and it's in a basically residential neighborhood (although the heart of bourbon is 2 blocks away if you want that). the staff is quirky but usually helpful. there is a grocery store 3 blocks away and a couple of nice neighborhood bars within a couple of blocks. the place stays booked with travelers looking to save a buck on a room so they can spend it on some other kind of fun. no frills but it does the trick for us.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good for the price Date of stay: Jan 12, 2004 Hotel location: French Quarter, on corner of St Peter St  Dauphine, 2 blocks from Bourbon St. Lots of restaurants  touristy shops within 5 blocks. Room location: ground floor, facing courtyard facing St Peter St. Metal spiral staircase right across from my room made for a lot of noise as people clambered up  down the stairs, esp at night. A lot of street noise at night, either from St Peters St or Dauphine. Overall appearance: a little shabby behind the ears; could do with some renovation. Quality of room: Small room -- bed is just 2 - 3 steps from the door. Basic, a little more than spartan. Side table with lamp, digital alarm clock. Writing desk within arm's distance at other side of bed. Extended cable tv services. Door has half-window with sheer curtain which was not thick enough to block out courtyard lights (esp tree decorated with Xmas lights) or street lights. No closet in bedroom. No heating system -- temperature dropped to low 40s at night during my stay. Thin comforter. Quality of bathroom: About as large as the bedroom itself, maybe a tad larger. Large chair in a corner -- nice touch. Tiny closet in bathroom -- no hangers, no iron or ironing board. Quality of staff: ok but could do with more welcoming attitude. When I tried to check out at 7:10 a.m., the courtyard door leading to the front office was locked -- this was despite the desk clerk's notation in her log book that I would be checking out around 7 a.m. Another guest, too, was displeased that he was not able to get into the office. Breakfast: complimentary continental breakfast. It was supposed to have been available by 7 a.m.; however, only hot beverages were ready by 7:10 a.m. The pastries were still not available at the time I left the hotel at 7:20 a.m. Security: When I returned from dinner, I noticed that the courtyard door was not shut securely. Anyone coming in from the street could have opened that door easily. Security guard supposed to be on duty from 4'ish pm to 7:30 a.m.; however, during my stay, the security guard apparently left before 7 a.m. -- mgr thought he might have gone to check on the other 3 sister properties. Chain lock on room door. Recommendation: if you're comfortable with budget hotels and not expecting to be pampered. If you can afford to splurge an extra $10-15/night, try the sister property (can't remember its name) that is the next quality-level up.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't stay at St. Peter!! The worst experience we've ever had! Too many things wrong to mention but here are the highlights: The room was dirty, and the bathroom had hairs everywhere. I wouldn't go anywhere in this room without shoes. The AC didn't work right. We were short a pillow  finally found it in the dresser with blood on it and no case. There were few outlets, and they were so loose we coldn't keep things plugged in. Even though we had a double room w/ 4 people, we were never given 4 towels, and had to get them from the desk every time. Front desk hours seem erratic, couldn't always locate someone. In addition, front desk was VERY RUDE, abrupt and frankly mean. Others in our party had another room, and it was just as bad, not to mention a partially used bottle of personal lubricant left on their bed! This hotel was gross! I'm NOT used to staying at 4 star hotels; usually in N.O. we stay at the LeMothe house, which is in the same price range as St. Peter. I would warn anyone NOT to stay at St. Peter!!!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: What's Up Here.....This Place Sucks This place must be like Jekyl and Hyde judging by the reviews. Maybe the rooms are so substantially different? Our room had a hole in the wall, peeling or no paint on the toilet seat from urine, hairs all over the bathroom. This place is a dive. We left upon seeing the lack of accomodations and they still billed us for a night. I am protesting with my credit card because this hotel and all hotels should provide as advertised, clean, and reasonably expected accomodations. St. Peter House did not come close. Stay away and pay a little more money somewhere else. St. Peter House name probably fits because we feel like they really gave us the peter!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: No problems at the St Peter House I read the previous reviews about the St. peter house and was a little worried since I booked the room months in advanced. I found the hotel to be exactly what I was looking for, it was clean, close to Burbon street, and a great price for the location. If you are looking for extras you won't find then here it was a great place and would stay there again. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel don't stay here, go pay the 5 star price and stay else where. Once again well worth the price!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time My wife and I made our second trip to New Orleans in the fall of 2003, and decided to save a little money by staying at the St Peter House. Boy was that ever a huge mistake. First of all, the outdoor iron staircase is just barely wide enough for a person to walk up, WITHOUT luggage. When you finally make it upstairs, the balcony is in such bad shape, you worry if it will hold up for you to walk to your room. The room was tiny, but nice enough. No lights but the ceiling and no thermostat in the room. Our room was freezing cold when we arrived and the only way to fix it was to call the front desk. Probably the worst part of the room was the sad excuse for a door seperating the bathroom from the rest of the room. It was more of a screen than a door, so keep that in mind if you go with friends and not your spouse. The staff at the desk was rude and actually got into a verbal altercation while we were checking out. Not real professional when two staff members are about to come to blows in front of hotel guests. About the only positive was the fantastic location in the quarter; not too close, but not too far away.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: This Place Sucked!!!! My best friend and I checked into this hotel after making arrangements some weeks in advance only to be met with a nasty, ill-mannered female hotel manager who did not want to be there. She cut me off several times half way into sentences and basically provided me with little to no information on the accomodations at the hotel or the surroundings. The room was so nasty that my friend and I had to wear shoes because of the filth, there were NO towels and NO pillow cases. The tub and bathroom floor was filled with human hair and the orange scum in the bottom of the toilet was a Tell-tale sign that no one had bothered to put a brush to it in sometime. When we approached the blonde headed, overweight manager about the towels, she snapped at us again, waved her hand at us as if to wave us off, and delegated our receiving linens to yet another rude employee. Fortunately, we were able to locate another accomodation for the following night and vacate St Peter. I will so not be back there!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Adorable! I stayed there last Friday and fell in love immediately. The rooms are small and quaint--mine had an old leather chair in the corner--and VERY CLEAN. The air conditioning was wonderful and the continental breakfast was yummy. Eating in the courtyard of the guest house, drinking coffee, listening to the city wake up in the morning--it was like a dream come true. The woman at the front desk was super nice to me when I checked in and out. I got there very early the day I checked in and she immediately offered me breakfast and coffee, and then told me I should saunter down to the river or to the French Market while my room was being prepared. When I returned, she made great suggestions for places to go during my stay.I will definitely return to St. Peter's guest house during my next visit to New Orleans. I think the people who are writing bad reviews must have a) somehow interacted with the owner when she was having a bad day b) must be used to staying in four-star hotels. St. Peter's guest house is not a four-star hotel by any means, but I think it is far better--an authentic slice of New Orleans life, at a very affordable price.Seriously, go check it out. Check out the gorgeous doors, the courtyards, the quaint rooms. I dare anyone not to fall in love with this place!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
